snippet: What could be more destructive to an informed citizenry than the threat of the death penalty or life imprisonment for whistle-blowers?
abstract: Op-Ed article by Prof Yochai Benkler and lawyer Floyd Abrams warns prosecution of Pfc Bradley Manning, if successful, will establish chilling precedent of subjecting person who leaks national security information to capital prosecution or at least life imprisonment; urges prosecution to use Manning's guilty plea on lesser charges to steer clear of setting precedent that would create severe threat to future whistle-blowers.

byline.original: By FLOYD ABRAMS and YOCHAI BENKLER

lead_paragraph: What could be more destructive to an informed citizenry than the threat of the death penalty or life imprisonment for whistle-blowers?

headline.seo: The Impact of the Bradley Manning Case

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
